story:
The Story

Down the Rabbit Hole: A Year in the Life of a Sexy Mama, explores theatrically the transformative first year of motherhood for a woman immersed in alternative sexual subculture. To illustrate this transformation I will interweave elements and characters of Lewis Caroll's childhood story Alice in Wonderland, along with video pieces that will be projected onto a screen on stage. The video pieces consist of several parodies of queer-sploitation films that illustrate societal fear of non-traditional parenting and non-traditional family dynamics that include LGBT and sex workers. Video elements will also include fragments of interviews from other queer and sex worker moms and parents about their first year of motherhood and their transformative experience. I plan on incorporating interactive elements into the theater piece that creates a sense of playfulness amongst in the audience. Elements of play that may be incorporated include a game of Twister that incorporates concepts around the body image and body perception of nursing mothers, Pin the Combat Boots on the Queer Mommy, and the Caterpillar Confessional in which audience members answer the question "Who are you?" through a tin-can telephones. 


In this theater piece, I play a character that resembles Alice from Alice in Wonderland, modified with autobiographical elements from my life as seen through the lens of Alice.  My character is adventurous and curious, but somewhat lost in her new surroundings of "Mama-land". 

Alice follows a Playboy bunny down the rabbit hole and into Mama-land.  During her journey she encounters characters and situations that challenge her concept of her own identity and the woman that she is transforming into.  At times she appears to be too small, at times too big.  Alice illustrates this feeling of awkward body image as she is changing into her clothes for a photo shoot and struggles to find anything that fits.  Alice faces her new identity head on as she finds herself at a Mad Hatter tea party with the Mad Hatter and the March Hare.  After consuming a cup of tea, Alice shrinks in size again and comes in contact with the Caterpillar as played by Sadie Lune, as a Zen-like dominant Mistress. I plan on illustrating Alice's shrinking size by oversized props and size manipulation of the objects projected on the screen behind Alice and the Caterpillar. Alice engages in a ritualistic performance involving aerial suspension and candles as the Caterpillar asks the question "Who are you?" As elements of Alice's identity unfold, corresponding imagery appears onto the screen behind them. 


The Impact

My deepest hopes for this project are to foster a greater sense of connection and community with LGBT mothers, sex workers, and those living within alternative family dynamics. I also seek to further explore and deconstruct the political/societal dynamics that lie at the heart of these issues. By bringing these modern issues into a timeless childhood tale I can better illustrate the concept of the Madonna and the whore, seen on one stage, as one image, as one complex individual not neatly compartmentalized stereo types.

Down the Rabbit Hole is a mixture of relatable experiences for any mother: the heartwarming joy of witnessing your child's first smile, first step, first word, the absolute exhaustion of sleep deprivation from multiple middle of the night feedings, or the uniqueness involved in being a sex working mother.

There are many misconceptions and fears in our society at large regarding the status of mothers who are also sex workers. This lack of understanding and pervasive sex negativity can have strong consequences for such mothers, and more generally for those with alternative family structures. For example, the risk of women in the sex industry having custody of their children removed from them because of their profession is a very real threat that many women face. Earlier this year Kendra Holiday, well known sex blogger and sex positive activist, was sued for full custody of her daughter by her husband after he became upset by sex negative shock waves generated by a local newspaperâ€™s cover story on Holiday.  Holiday's husband tried to prove that she was an unfit mother due to her work in the sex industry.

A further example can be found in the experience of mainstream actress and long time collaborator of mine, Sasha Grey. An "ex-porn star," Grey recently underwent a barrage of press and media attacks after her participating in the children's literacy program "Read Across America" in which she read several story books to first graders at an elementary school in LA's Compton area. The public, media, and press seem to perpetuate a fear of child corruption by anyone involved in the sex industry or visibly existing outside of traditional family structures. 

This past summer a lesbian couple was asked to turn their shirts inside out before they could enter the amusement park, DollyWood, in Pigeon Forge, TN.  They were told that the amusement park was a place for families and the shirt was not family friendly.  The text on the shirt read, "Marriage is so Gay" and the couple were with their family. 

My goal for this work is to bring attention to these behaviors, this fear of difference, of otherness and create a safer space and community support and dialogue for queer families. It is only by raising these issues strongly, and demonstrating their profound injustice, that we can hope to make some change to these negative stereotypes.

What We Need & What You Get

This proposal seeks $10,000 for the creation and development of a new multi-media theater piece regarding queer motherhood and sexuality. Down the Rabbit Hole: A Year in the Life of a Sexy Mama, is loosely based on Lewis Caroll's classic story of a girl in search of her identity, Alice in Wonderland. This piece will be written and performed by noted artist, sex worker, and new mom Madison Young.

 Leslie Einhorn will dramaturge and direct. The world premiere will run over 3 weekends (12 shows) at San Franciscoâ€™s CounterPulse theater space in the SOMA. This event will be co-presented by Femina Potens Art Gallery, a leading voice for the Queer and GBLTQI community in San Francisco for over a decade. 

Awarded funds will support artist fees for the writer/performer, director, and cast, as well as fees for a graphic designer, rehearsal space, venue, and promotional materials.  


Check out all of the amazing and unique perks that you can get for supporting this groundbreaking theater project.

story:
Sickle Moon are proud to present their second production for Theatre Upstairs. A new adaptation of Robert Louis Stevensons' Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde by Finbarr Doyle and Jeda de Brí. Immerse yourself in the world of Victorian London – its upper crust, its seedy underbelly, its contradictions and contrasts. A new version of the classic story, this two-man monologue play will feature Paul Travers as Henry Jekyll and Finbarr Doyle as Edward Hyde. Come along this Hallowe'en to discover one mans mind torn apart and remade by violence, power and desire.


The show will run from 22nd October - 2nd November. 

Tues-Sat at 1pm, Thurs-Sat at 7pm.

Your contributions will go towards

  • Our costume department - Creating and sourcing a disparate yet unified look to Jekyll and Hydes suits, in a Steampunk Victorian Style.
  • Our Set design - creating both Jekyll's laboratory and the foggy streets of Soho.
  • Our poster design and printing costs.



This will be Sickle Moon's second production for theatre, and their second collaboration with  Theatre Upstairs, Eden Quay.

Their first theatre piece, Ian McEwans "Conversation With a Cupboard Man" was performed in June 2013 and received very positive reviews for its star (Finbarr Doyle) and director (Jeda de Brí).

"Strange Case of Doctor Jekyll and Mister Hyde" reunites the team behind Cupboard man - set designer Aoife Fealy (B.A. Fine Art from IADT) and lighting designer Eoghan Carrick. 

Joining us for this production are our costume designers Nicola Burke and Christina Byrne (B.A. Design for Stage and Screen from Irelands National Film School). 

Reviews for our previous work - 

'Profoundly depressing, eerily convincing, and quite forcibly repellent... McEwan's mastery of words is well served by Finbarr Doyle's contained and varied performance.' Emer O'Kelly, Sunday Independent 

'Quiet, unassuming and beautiful, if anything is going to pull you from the glorious sunshine into a warm dark room, let it be this production...' - Gillian Greer, Meg.ie

story:
PLAYGROUND explores the volatile relationship of four people in a working class neighborhood. Set in and around a bodega, the characters' seemingly mundane conversations about dead-end jobs, friendship, masculinity, pride, and above all, desire, unearth an unconscious legacy of violence.

Chris and Kayley meet several times at the bodega, developing a relationship that is subtly flirtatious and antagonistic. Throughout the play, Chris and the other men (Kayley's Dad, and Chris' co-worker Ezekiel) engage in aggressive, sexually suggestive banter towards Kayley, manipulating her as an object of their desire. The men exploit gender inequality to build their own individual sense of power, while Kayley uses her wit to assert her independence. 

FROM PLAYWRIGHT AND DIRECTOR DEREK SPALDO, Playground has been workshopped at Dixon Place and Greenpoint Pre-Apocalyptic Theatre Festival, and features a brilliant cast of Sarah Willis (Kayley), Aron Canter (Ezekiel), Michel Morin (Dad), and WooJae Chung (Chris), with Rachel Chatham (Lighting Design), Alison Irvine (Production Assistant), and Eric Borlaug (Development) rounding out the stellar production team.  

The play has been in development for over a year with the same close-knit ensemble. After a rigorous writing and rehearsal process, we are thrilled to debut this new work.

Tickets are available now via OVATIONTIX.

Playground will run as a Co-Production at The Brick in Brooklyn: 

August 21 - 30, 2014. 

Performances Thursday, Friday, and Saturday at 7pm

The Brick

579 Metropolitan Ave

Brooklyn, NY 11211

www.bricktheater.com

YOUR SUPPORT IS VITAL TO THIS PRODUCTION.  By supporting our campaign you can help us reach our goal to offset the costs of studio space for rehearsals, costumes and scenic design for production, and stipends for our artists and technicians.  

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP --- please share this link with as many people as you can. Also, please visit, share, and like our Facebook page. While the Playground company is hard at work in the studio, you can help us spread the word about the show!

story:
This summer, the second-year class at the University of Waterloo School of Architecture will be presenting the play Erebus & Terror, based on Mary Shelley's novel Frankenstein and John Franklin's quest for the Northwest Passage. The students are putting together the entire production including writing an original script, creating a music score, choreographing performances, designing the set, and making props and costumes.
The play will be presented on August 1-3 in Cambridge, Ontario.

 

We're hoping to raise $10,000 from student contributions, local business sponsorships, material donations, and hopefully you!
The money raised will go toward things such as paying for the venue, funding set-building materials, renting musical instruments, and buying costume materials.

 

Thank you,
University of Waterloo School of Architecture, Class of 2016

story:
Willow Chang Alléon, a Hawaii born and based multidisciplined artist, known for artistry, creativity & grace, has been invited to teach & perform at the 1st Bollywood Dance Festival in Athens, Greece! Her sponsor can cover travel from Europe, let's send our Honolulu Honey to the continent! Aloha, Opa and Namsate!

www.willowchang.com

Dance is the ultimate excercise in humility.- wca

This is something I believe from my heart of hearts, as dance allows us share what makes us human. The strenghts and frailty of the human condition are present, as are the limits of the human body.Dance is fragile and empheral- blink, as you may miss it.

I have danced my whole life, and it has been a limitless abundance- the teachers and gurus who have shared with me, the cultures I celebrate, the tradions I honor and the new expressions I explore are what I strive to share, without reservation. Whether it be Oriental bellydance, Indian Bollywood,Classical dances of the temple, my original dance journey of Hawaiian Hula, modern, fusion or theatrical dances, teaching, singing or composing dances, songs or poetry- I seek the common thread of celebration of the alchemy of life, the magic, of creation, the humility of being Human!

I grew up on an island. Hawaii is defined as one of the most geographically isolated places on Earth. And yet, by fate and hard work, I have been lucky enough to travel: see other places, countries, cultures, climates, experience life in people's homes, milongas, beaches, sunsets, their rainy season, souks and shopping centers, try new foods, dress in different ways, walked through their graveyards and climbed their mountains.

Even though I have been abroad, it NEVER gets old, I am Never jaded. Each opportunity is new, fresh,unique and real: I live to share Aloha, kindness, compassion, dialogue and encourage other artists to celebrate their uniqie voice, which we all have. I come in peace and I return in peace.

GREECE, pt. 3

Imagine my surprise to be contacted to teach and perform in Athens for their 1st Bollywood Dance Festival! I ahve taught and performed twice before in Athens, in 2006 at the UNESCO International dance Council, where I presented my theatrical Medusa dance, entitled Ourobouros and taught Oriental bellydance.

In 2009, I was invited to teach again, this time with sponsor Aisha Kanakari, sharing the arts of Bellydance, Hawaiian Hula and Bollywood.

The 1st Bollywood Festival of Athens brings artsist from India, Spain, Greece and Hawaii ;) to celebrate the global and India dancs of Bollywood Dance! I'll be teaching hawaiian Hula as a narrative dance form,as well as performing twice! The 3 day festival features workshops and a gala show. held at the hstoric Dora Stratou Theater. This, is such an HONOR!

What I Need

My sponsors are generously providing travel and accomdations from Europe- so therefore, I need to get to the continent of Europe, from Hawaii. I am flying to Zurich, a maor internation flight hub, as I can stay with friends without charge. A round trip from Honolulu is costly- both time wise (rooghly a 24 hour hour trip in total, and a 12 hour time difference) and starts at $1800. Factor in luggage costs/fees, meals abroad, taxes and transporation, $2700 with go very quickly. (If my goal is not met, all funds, regardless of amount, will go to defray the costs which I will encur to get to the event.)

I am also doing local fundraing as well, Henna/mendhi, performances, and vending to attempt to off set costs.

As an independent artist/contractor, I have no paid vacation, or perks to aid in my journey.

(Admittedly, simply asking for funding is new for me, and I am deeply moved and grateful for people's previous generosity.)

The opportunity to share Aloha, to encourage others to live their art, speak their voice, follow their dream- it what motivates me. It is a circle of Aloha that has no ending or beginning- and it's a gift that continues when I return to Hawaii, and lives in the hearts of everyone who we've encountered.

I will be sending my daily (and it is incessant and steady!) updates from the travels abroad! Poems, photos, videos, insights, meditations, thoughts, links and reports will be posted on my facebook page, Willow Chang Alléon and Willow Chang Dance- so please so follow me, and have a virtual journey :) !

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Willow-Chang-Dance/123636121023835?fref=ts

How Can You Help?

 

There's many ways to help, please share in the way that's a fit, for you:

1) any donation of any amount is greatly and deeply appreciated. thank you!!!

2) If you can assist in getting the word out and make some noise about your campaign, I would REALLY appreciate! Friends of dance, people from Greece, Hawaii clubs, Bollywood groups, Bellydance peeps, lovers of the arts, warriors of Peace- we are all one! Send links for this to all you know- cause you NEVER know!

3)Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

I can't thank you enough for your time, support and interest!!!

much aloha,

willow

Dance is the ultimate excercise in humility.- wca
This is something I believe from my heart of hearts, as dance allows us share what makes us human. The strenghts and frailty of the human condition are present, as are the limits of the human body.Dance is fragile and empheral- blink, as you may miss it.
I have danced my whole life, and it has been a limitless abundance- the teachers and gurus who have shared with me, the cultures I celebrate, the tradions I honor and the new expressions I explore are what I strive to share, without reservation. Whether it be Oriental bellydance, Indian Bollywood,Classical dances of the temple, my original dance journey of Hawaiian Hula, modern, fusion or theatrical dances, teaching, singing or composing dances, songs or poetry- I seek the common thread of celebration of the alchemy of life, the magic, of creation, the humility of being Human!
I grew up on an island. Hawaii is defined as one of the most geographically isolated places on Earth. And yet, by fate and hard work, I have been lucky enough to travel: see other places, countries, cultures, climates, experience life in people's homes, milongas, beaches, sunsets, their rainy season, souks and shopping centers, try new foods, dress in different ways, walked through their graveyards and climbed their mountains.
Even though I have been abroad, it NEVER gets old, I am Never jaded. Each opportunity is new, fresh,unique and real: I live to share Aloha, kindness, compassion, dialogue and encourage other artists to celebrate their uniqie voice, which we all have. I come in peace and I return in peace.
GREECE, pt. 3
Imagine my surprise to be contacted to teach and perform in Athens for their 1st Bollywood Dance Festival! I ahve taught and performed twice before in Athens, in 2006 at the UNESCO International dance Council, where I presented my theatrical Medusa dance, entitled Ourobouros and taught Oriental bellydance.
In 2009, I was invited to teach again, this time with sponsor Aisha Kanakari, sharing the arts of Bellydance, Hawaiian Hula and Bollywood.
The 1st Bollywood Festival of Athens brings artsist from India, Spain, Greece and Hawaii ;) to celebrate the global and India dancs of Bollywood Dance! I'll be teaching hawaiian Hula as a narrative dance form,as well as performing twice! The 3 day festival features workshops and a gala show. held at the hstoric Dora Stratou Theater. This, is such an HONOR!
What I Need
My sponsors are generously providing travel and accomdations from Europe- so therefore, I need to get to the continent of Europe, from Hawaii. I am flying to Zurich, a maor internation flight hub, as I can stay with friends without charge. A round trip from Honolulu is costly- both time wise (rooghly a 24 hour hour trip in total, and a 12 hour time difference) and starts at $1800. Factor in luggage costs/fees, meals abroad, taxes and transporation, $2700 with go very quickly. (If my goal is not met, all funds, regardless of amount, will go to defray the costs which I will encur to get to the event.)
I am also doing local fundraing as well, Henna/mendhi, performances, and vending to attempt to off set costs.
As an independent artist/contractor, I have no paid vacation, or perks to aid in my journey.
(Admittedly, simply asking for funding is new for me, and I am deeply moved and grateful for people's previous generosity.)
The opportunity to share Aloha, to encourage others to live their art, speak their voice, follow their dream- it what motivates me. It is a circle of Aloha that has no ending or beginning- and it's a gift that continues when I return to Hawaii, and lives in the hearts of everyone who we've encountered.
I will be sending my daily (and it is incessant and steady!) updates from the travels abroad! Poems, photos, videos, insights, meditations, thoughts, links and reports will be posted on my facebook page, Willow Chang Alléon and Willow Chang Dance- so please so follow me, and have a virtual journey :) !
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Willow-Chang-Dance/123636121023835?fref=ts


How Can You Help?
 


There's many ways to help, please share in the way that's a fit, for you:
1) any donation of any amount is greatly and deeply appreciated. thank you!!!


2) If you can assist in getting the word out and make some noise about your campaign, I would REALLY appreciate! Friends of dance, people from Greece, Hawaii clubs, Bollywood groups, Bellydance peeps, lovers of the arts, warriors of Peace- we are all one! Send links for this to all you know- cause you NEVER know!
3)Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

I can't thank you enough for your time, support and interest!!!
much aloha,
willow

story:
We are Nina Millns and Sophie Morgan-Price and together we are London female comedy duo,Bae.

We are bringing our hilarious new character comedy show, "Help", to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival 2016: "Welcome to our self-help seminar where you will find yourself. Help us, help you, help us to help you." 

...No seriously, help us.

Who are we?

We are professional Actor / Writers with a passion for comedy. We have both worked extensively in Theatre, TV, Film and Radio and our award-winning work has established us as "ones to watch" (Lynne Parker - Founder of Funny Women).

We are also the new faces of the Funny Women Youtube Channel.

Nina is a South Londoner with a Greek-Cypriot background and Sophie is from South Wales with Spanish ancestry dating back to the turn of the century. 

Enough about us - let's talk money. 

Dollar

We are aiming to raise £5,000 in total, with an initial target of £3,000 to take our show to Edinburgh. Your money will be spent directly on:

- Venue hire

- PR Company

- London Previews

- Marketing resources (photographer, flyers & posters)

- Accommodation 

- Travel

- Technician

*We want complete transparency, so please do message us with any further questions you may have on exactly where the budget is going: 

info@baecomedy.co.uk

Why Help Us?

Taking our first show to Edinburgh is a big deal for us as it establishes us as an act in our own right. This is our first year on the circuit and we have hit the ground running, gigging regularly on the London scene.

We're eager to keep that momentum going and to keep expanding, which is why we are now working with a PR company.

We are two women from working-class backgrounds pushing hard to make it in a challenging industry. We want to follow in the footsteps of French & Saunders, Smack the Pony, Patsy & Eddie and, of course, Victoria Wood.

You can follow us on: 

https://twitter.com/BaeComedyDuo

https://www.facebook.com/baecomedy/

https://www.instagram.com/baecomedyduo/

Perks

Aside from a guaranteed place in Heaven...

  • For £10 you will get a personal mention on Facebook and Twitter
  • For £25  you get a recording of our guided meditation
  • For £35 you get a recording of our guided meditation AND a personal mantra for life
  • For £50 you get all of the above plus a quick, painless ritual that will ensure you a very prominent place at the table of the afterlife (plus a free ticket to our London preview)
  • For £100 or more (well done you!) you get all of the above plus a Dinosaur Blessing AND a DVD full of extra footage for your amusement.

* Another way you can help is by sharing this campaign as far and wide as your network reaches! 

Gathering the right team around us is essential to our vision and our success and each one of you who contributes to this project will be an important member of our team.

Thank you!

Your Baes, 

Nina and Sophie x

story:
"Help us take "TIMELESS" to Hollywood Fringe! We are raising funding for 

THE SHOW'S FIRST THEATRICAL RUN AT THE HOLLYWOOD FRINGE FEST & EDINBURGH FRINGE FESTIVAL IN SCOTLAND!

“Timeless” is a one-hour dramatic interpretation of sonnets, prose, poetic verse and quotes by great writers around the world from the ancient past to our time. Perfect for anyone who has a love for literature and is affected by Time, a universal topic that concerns us all.

                                                                ❤️❤️❤️❤️

We have the venue and production team all ready to go, but we need additional funds to cover the costs of this innovatively conceived dramatized poetic   performance. These additional funds will cover things like venue staffing, accommodation, marketing , and travel to the Fringe in Scotland. 

                      Any amount is appreciated and truly makes a difference!

                                     An evening of timeless poetic repertoire 

                                                                     

                                 ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

                                The Impact!

With your help Timeless will premiere with 4 performances at Hudson Guild Theatre during the 2016 Hollywood Fringe Festival

The show will provide an opportunity to showcase all that I've loved and learned to Los Angeles audiences. We're launching in Los Angeles with the intent of touring this one-man show around the country and taking it abroad to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival.

Although it will be hard work and a pretty big risk, we think going to the Fringe will be an invaluable experience for us as a company. We love this show so much and want nothing more than to share it with the world and make it the best it can possibly be. 

Time is a powerful entity, greater than ourselves. Everything changes, everything fades away. The Pharaohs of ancient Egypt and other bygone civilizations are our best examples. This Timeless production will evoke your highest spirits as it challenges time to stand still for us to understand it, take a peak at it and become its friends, rather than its foe.

                                                              ❤️❤️❤️❤️             

I’m incredibly excited that I am finally picking up where my dream left off, but I need your help.  So this is why we’ve made this Crowdfunder - because there are lovely, wonderful, generous souls in the world… Like you. That's why we're asking, ever so nicely, for your help.

And for every person that lends a hand, we’re eternally grateful. And with sincerity, supporting us gives us the drive and ambition to keep going – WE WILL NOT LET YOU DOWN. But, sometimes saying thank you isn’t enough – and so for your donation you will receive a gift. Some big and some small. It’s the least we can do to say THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU! MASSIVE THANKS

                                                         ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
What We Need & What You Get

What We Need:

The following is a breakdown of expenses ( so you can be confident in where your money is going):

Hollywood Fringe Festival Registration Fee:  $250

Hudson Guild Theater Venue Rental for four shows: $1000

Production stipends (which include Costume Designer, Prop Designer, Sound Designer, Director): $1750

Production materials (which includes costumes and props): $700

Advertising & Printing (which includes Posters, Postcards, Program, Mailing, PR, and Graphic Designer): $2000

Videographer, royalties for archive stills and music: $700


                                                                ❤️❤️❤️❤️

What You Get: 

Make sure to look at "Perks" for your unique rewards for helping us! 

                                                                

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some may not be able to make a monetary contribution, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  •  Get the word out and make some noise about "Timeless."
  • Send me your good wishes and love to feed my spirit too.

Thank you for supporting creativity, art & also supporting artists like me!


I am  self-funding a large portion of the money that is needed to send me to these festivals on my own, but will not be able to make enough in time for both festivals, which are happening in June and August. This show is the most important thing to me- it means the world to me to be able to perform as an actor again. And who knows... this could be my last entrance and exit before the light goes out.

Production materials (which includes costumes and props): $700
Advertising & Printing (which includes Posters, Postcards, Program, Mailing, PR, and Graphic Designer): $2000
Videographer, royalties for archive stills and music: $700

                                                                ❤️❤️❤️❤️
What You Get: 
Make sure to look at "Perks" for your unique rewards for helping us! 
                                                                



Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that some may not be able to make a monetary contribution, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

 Get the word out and make some noise about "Timeless."
Send me your good wishes and love to feed my spirit too.





Thank you for supporting creativity, art & also supporting artists like me!




I am  self-funding a large portion of the money that is needed to send me to these festivals on my own, but will not be able to make enough in time for both festivals, which are happening in June and August. This show is the most important thing to me- it means the world to me to be able to perform as an actor again. And who knows... this could be my last entrance and exit before the light goes out.

story:
"A rousing tale of techno-geek rebellion, as necessary and dangerous as file sharing, free speech, and bottled water on a plane."  -Scott Westerfeld

Our Story

Custom Made is producing the WORLD PREMIERE of Josh Costello's adaptation of Cory Doctorow's Little Brother!  Little Brother is an important, entertaining near-future story about what rights we have already given up, and what might happen to the rest of our privacy and free-speech after the next terrorist attack.  It is also a love story, a tale of teenage rebellion, and a love-letter to the Bay Area.

This high-tech tale is about NOW!  We need your help to make this multi-media play as brilliant as it needs to be.  We need to raise money to help pay for a projector, a video artist, and maybe even a hacker or two.  Custom Made's ticket sales only cover 50% of our production costs, even on our low-tech shows.  For a show like Little Brother to be a success we need an additional $6500 to supplement our normal production budget. 

About Little Brother:

In the aftermath of a terrorist attack on San Francisco, 17-year-old tech hacker Marcus is suddenly apprehended by the Department of Homeland Security for days of merciless interrogation. 

When no one besides his friends believes his story, he’s left with only one option: take down the system himself. Could this near-future story by the award-winning novelist and BoingBoing editor really happen here... or has it already begun?

What We Need & What You Get

We expect the extra multi-media equipment, and set up, we need will cost $5500.  We will either buy the best one we can from money raised, or rent an insanely awesome set of multi-media projectors and equipment    Extra staffing on this show is going to cost another $1000. All this is above and beyond the normal operational budget Custom Made has for our shows.


We have put together some exciting perks, including invitations to the first read, opening night, and Little Brother bookplates signed by Cory Doctorow himself!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us by spreading the word!

story:
No donation is too small!

Our Goal: Keep ‘Em Laughing

As Milton Berle said, laughter is an instant vacation. We are thrilled to bring Ron Clark and Sam Bobrick's screwball comedy, “Murder at the Howard Johnson’s,” to the Studio Theatre at Theatre Row, on 42nd Street in New York City.

Our goal with this production is two-fold: First, we want to provide a showcase for some wonderfully talented, creative people. Jeremy Bright, our producer, heads up a terrific team that includes: Heather Olmstead (Stage Manager), Abbey Dehnert (Props & Asst. Set Design), Ed Davis (Sound Design), Geoffrey Bryant (Lighting Design), Nathan Dehnert (Stage Crew) and Terry Borzumato (Media Design). Our cast is made up of three accomplished New York actors: Rutanya Alda (http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0017377/), Allan Greenberg (http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2412625/) and Frank Gauthier (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h4jqqCzjdTo). Our Director, Eddie Lew, has directed over 35 plays in New York venues among his credits, studied for five years with the HB studio, is a member of the HB Playwright’s Foundation Advanced/Actor Lab, where he had the privilege of studying and working on productions with Uta Hagen, Salem Ludwig, Charles Nelson Reilly, George Bartenieff and Karen Malpied; he has also served as the Director of the resident company at the Schimmel Center for the Performing Arts at Pace University.

Second, and as corny as this may sound, we think people need more opportunities to laugh—inexpensively. Although New York has some of the most amazing theatre in the world, inexpensive is a word rarely associated with it. Affordable $18 tickets give theatergoers an opportunity to escape to an evening of outrageous fun without the outrageous cost.

 

How Do You Fit into the Crime?

To help make this experience a reality, we thought it might be fun and rewarding for all of our colleagues, friends, family and those new to our work to aid in a very critical part of the process—the financing. By contributing whatever you can through Indiegogo to our “Murder at the Howard Johnson’s” production, you’ll be helping us achieve our two-fold goal of showcasing the talents of some amazing people and showering the masses with an evening of much-needed laughter.

We have numerous hard costs to satisfy—the theater rental, the play rights, insurance, set construction, publicity, wardrobe, and the material needs of our team, who are donating their time. Between ticket sales and your generosity, we hope to meet these costs and compensate our hard-working production team.  

 

About the Play

Is all fair in love? Even murder? That’s the question posed by this quirky, hilarious suspenseful comedy about a love triangle in a Howard Johnson Motor Inn. In 1979, Mitchell Lovell, a commonplace dentist who imagines himself as a dashing hero, conspires with Arlene Miller, a “Femme Fatale” (of sorts), to murder her husband Paul, a blundering, monochromatic, money-obsessed used car salesman. However, as confident as this trio believes themselves to be, their criminal plans quickly go more awry than President Carter’s intervention in Iran.

 

Background: The Road to Murder

A year and half ago, Rutanya Alda and Allan Greenberg performed a comedic scene in a master acting class taught by acclaimed director, producer and teacher, Ed Sherin, who came to national prominence when he directed James Earl Jones and Jane Alexander in “The Great White Hope” on Broadway in 1967. The scene Rutanya and Allan performed was from “LUV” by Murray Schisgal. Ed thought so much of the work he recommended they produce it themselves.

In February of 2012, we secured the rights to “LUV” from the Dramatists Play Service. Needless to say, we were very happy. We booked the Studio Theatre at Theatre Row on 42nd Street in New York, for a September 13 to October 7 run. We formed a production team and began our search for a director and a third actor. In late May, we found our director and then on June 6th, the proverbial hit the fan when Mr. Schisgal pulled the rights without warning, having never met with us. Although this hurt, it didn’t deter us. We fielded play suggestions from colleagues all over the world and camped out at The Drama Book Shop reading, and reading, and reading. The suggestion of “Murder at the Howard Johnson’s” came from our friend and fellow actor, Josef Pfitzer, of Munich, Germany , and we fell in love with it.

To help make this experience a reality, we thought it might be fun and rewarding for all of our colleagues, friends, family and those new to our work to aid in a very critical part of the process—the financing. By contributing whatever you can through Indiegogo to our “Murder at the Howard Johnson’s” production, you’ll be helping us achieve our two-fold goal of showcasing the talents of some amazing people and showering the masses with an evening of much-needed laughter.
We have numerous hard costs to satisfy—the theater rental, the play rights, insurance, set construction, publicity, wardrobe, and the material needs of our team, who are donating their time. Between ticket sales and your generosity, we hope to meet these costs and compensate our hard-working production team.  
 
About the Play
Is all fair in love? Even murder? That’s the question posed by this quirky, hilarious suspenseful comedy about a love triangle in a Howard Johnson Motor Inn. In 1979, Mitchell Lovell, a commonplace dentist who imagines himself as a dashing hero, conspires with Arlene Miller, a “Femme Fatale” (of sorts), to murder her husband Paul, a blundering, monochromatic, money-obsessed used car salesman. However, as confident as this trio believes themselves to be, their criminal plans quickly go more awry than President Carter’s intervention in Iran.
 
Background: The Road to Murder
A year and half ago, Rutanya Alda and Allan Greenberg performed a comedic scene in a master acting class taught by acclaimed director, producer and teacher, Ed Sherin, who came to national prominence when he directed James Earl Jones and Jane Alexander in “The Great White Hope” on Broadway in 1967. The scene Rutanya and Allan performed was from “LUV” by Murray Schisgal. Ed thought so much of the work he recommended they produce it themselves.
In February of 2012, we secured the rights to “LUV” from the Dramatists Play Service. Needless to say, we were very happy. We booked the Studio Theatre at Theatre Row on 42nd Street in New York, for a September 13 to October 7 run. We formed a production team and began our search for a director and a third actor. In late May, we found our director and then on June 6th, the proverbial hit the fan when Mr. Schisgal pulled the rights without warning, having never met with us. Although this hurt, it didn’t deter us. We fielded play suggestions from colleagues all over the world and camped out at The Drama Book Shop reading, and reading, and reading. The suggestion of “Murder at the Howard Johnson’s” came from our friend and fellow actor, Josef Pfitzer, of Munich, Germany , and we fell in love with it.
